abstracts.cdata!:
Overall, the outcome of the project is
            satisfactory, since it contributed dramatically to the
            economic and political transition of the country. The
            improvement of the educational system ensured an annual
            enrollment expansion of over ten percent. However, the
            performance of the Bank gave mixed results, for, although
            project identification was satisfactory, preparation and
            appraisal were considered marginally satisfactory, since
            political and economic transition circumstances, hindered
            the seemingly ambitious project. Nevertheless, the
            performance of the Borrower was rated satisfactory, with
            gradual improvements in preparation, implementation, and
            compliance with covenants. The lessons learned suggest that
            the positive impact on learning outcomes, stems from the
            implementation of activities, in line with the responsible
            directorates, who are accountable for budget and program
            management. The Bank's responsiveness, and flexibility
            in project design became extremely critical during
            implementation, when rapid political and economic changes
            occurred. Hence, easier administrative/procedural
            requirements would be beneficial under changing
            circumstances. Extreme caution should be given for complex
            project design, particularly under weak institutional
            capacity, or political unrest, which may constrain
            partnerships, and cross-conditionalities, and, make it
            difficult for the Bank to manage, when not a party to the agreement.
